S.FORM: pai gacalji a mapuljat paka kicungali.
djavadjavay sinsi.
qiladju.
djavadjavay a mapuljat, tucu uri temulu ti sinsi ta nakakanen a pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的東排灣語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Paiwanese.

S.FORM: nasepualang anga sun tu anemamaya ti sinsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi maqati sun a mumalj a puita, ini anan aken nasepualan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: pacunu a pasa maza! kaciuri a kisupu.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: bulay angata a su kinisupuan.
mumalju anan a puita, sa papezangalu nukisupu sun.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: maliceng maya kiljavaran.
alapu a su sapitj.
ui sinsi.
sinsi, na maadjuq a ku inpic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: alapu a su siquliqulip.
sinsi na maadjuq a ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kisedjamu a su salasaladj tua siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: maqati sun a pasedjam tjanuaken ta su siquliqulip?
tjaljumaza anga tja kitulu.
ucevungi anga nu tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: tima sun?
ti dremedreman aken a ljatjamatjakan.
tima sun?
ti dremedreman aken. ni druay a aljak.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of drangadrang, my name is djilu.

S.FORM: tima sun?
ti giu aken. ni piya sinsi a situ.
S.TRANSL: I’m a student of piya, I’m giu.

S.FORM: tima su ngadan?
ti kadrui a ku ngadan.
tima ngadan na su kama?
ti sedjam a ngadan na ku kama.
tima azua?
ti muakay timadju.
tima timadju?
ti sedjam a ngadan na ku kaka a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is sedjam.

S.FORM: tima a ngadan nimadju?
ti sedjam a ngadan nimadju.
ti buku a ngadan nimadju?
ui, ti buku a ngadan nimadju.
ti piya a ngadan nimadju?
ini, ti ljua a ngadan nimadju.
tima azua?
ti kina i tjuku
tima azua?
ku drangi a ti vais.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是vais。
She’s my friend, her name is vais.

S.FORM: pida anga su cavilj?
tapuluq anga ku cavilj.
pida anga cavilj nimadju?
tapuluq saka drusa anga cavilj nimadju.
pida anga cavilj na su kama?
lima puluq anga cavilj na ku kama.
mapida su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: madrusa a ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay kata vavayan, madrusa ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay kata vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，兩個弟弟妹妹。
I have two older siblings and two younger siblings.

S.FORM: izua su kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay?
neka ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay.
mapida mun a taqumaqanan?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: ma sepatj amen a taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: inuan sun a temakesikesi?
i valangaw aken a temakesikesi.
tima azua?
ti kama i sedjam timadju.
anema sengesengan ni kama i sedjam?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: kisac a sengesengan nimadju.
tima azua?
ku kaka a tjavulung a vavayan.
izua sengesengan na su kaka a tjavulung a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: i biuing a sengesengan nimadju.
mare vetjek azua madrusa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: mare kaka azua madrusa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: mare ngedruq azua madrusa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: ini, mare qali tiamadju.
kacalisian sun?
ui, payuan aken a kacalisian.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I'm from the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: kacalisian a su cekelj?
ui, sepiuma timadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she's from the Puyuma tribe.

S.FORM: qaca a su kama?
ui qaqacan amen a taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: temakesikesi anga su kaka a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: ui, temakesikesi anga timadju.
saigu a su kaka a penaiwanan?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: ui, saigu a penaiwanan tiamadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: mapida su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: matjelu a ku siruvetjek.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: na matevelj sun kata su matjaljaljak?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: ui, na matevelj aken kata ku matjaljaljak.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: na matevelj sun katia su vuvu?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, inika amen a namatevelj.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: tima su kinateveljan?
na matevelj aken kata ku matjaljaljak, izuanan a ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: nakemasi nu sun?
nakemasi valangaw aken.
inuan a nu umaq?
i kuvaleng a nia umaq.
senema sun?
sekacedas aken.
inuan a nu qinaljan?
i kuvaleng a nia qinaljan.
nungida su sisaqinaljan?
S.TRANSL: When will you return to the tribe?

S.FORM: nu kaljazalangezangan a ku sisaqinaljanan.
S.TRANSL: I always go back to my tribe in the summer.

S.FORM: aljak aken nua paiwan.
S.TRANSL: I'm a child of the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: uri namakuda kinaqadavan nusauni?
qemadaw anga nazemulezul a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: naljemaljeqelan a i sasaw?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: ui naljemaljeqelan, kavau ta kedremedremel a kava.
S.TRANSL: 是,很冷，要穿保暖的衣服。
It's cold, so wear warm clothes.

S.FORM: nasemezam a i sasaw?
ini, venalivali anga.
uri namakuda a kinaqadavan nusauni?
ruarua a kinaqadavan kasauni.
namakuda a kelevelevan nuqezemetj?
neka nu qerepus i kalevelevan, tjevuta anga vitjuqan uta.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星也出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: namakuda a kalevelevan tucu?
tjaukameljay minqut anga quljivangeraw.
S.TRANSL: The rain has just stopped and the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: namakuda a kalevelevan izua i tjanumun?
venalivali anga imaza i tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: bulay a kinaqadavan izua?
ui, bulay a kinaqadavan imaza.
uri sema gakku anga ken.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: na ljemaljeqelan, paka liavu a kemava.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: uri sema sasaw anga ken.
paqenetju a masi ljinay, uri qemudjalj nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: uri qemudjalj?
na cemelalaq kasauni, uri qemudjalj anga.
S.TRANSL: It just thundered, it's going to rain.

S.FORM: naqemudjalj anga?
ui, na qemudjalj kasauni, ljakua na meljay anga.
S.TRANSL: 是的,剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: qemudjalj anga?
tjevetjeveng a kadjalanan, matu na qemudjalj kasauni.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: na qemudjalj? aku tjevetjeveng a su kacavacavang?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: ui paljeqaca a qudjalj i sasaw, ika aken a na masi ljinay.
S.TRANSL: 是,外面下大雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
namavali a aken, sika saqetjuqetju a ku qulu.
S.TRANSL: 我吹到風，所以我頭在痛。
My head is blowing in the wind, so I have a headache now.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
malingac aken, qaca aravac a qadaw kasauni.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: namadraudrau aken a masi inpic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: ku pasedjamai sun.
namadraudrau aken a masi qecap.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ari veli, inika ken a na masi qecap uta.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: kiciur sun a veneli ta inpic?
ui, uri veneli aken ta siquliqulip uta.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: ari a veneli ta tja kenamain.
ini, na kenama anga aken i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: namadraudrau aken a semeljec ta ku tjinaljek.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: alapu seljecu a pakirimu!
namadraudrau aken a masi tjinaljek.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kani ta ku tjinaljek numaya.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: anema uri su kencengeljen?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman aken i gakku ta ku cengelj.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: anema uri su kencengeljen?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: na kemacu aken ta ku kanen, kaciuri a keman.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: ari a benuru?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: ui ari!!
ari a benuru ta yakiw?
ini, liaw aravac a ku vaveciken.
S.TRANSL: 不要，我還有很多作業要寫。

S.FORM: alapan aken ta suapan.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: ui, aicu a suapan.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: alapan aken ta zuking.
paalapan tjai kuliw, semuasuap anan aken.
S.TRANSL: 我還在掃地，你叫kuliw幫你拿。
I'm still sweeping the floor, you ask kuliw to help you.

S.FORM: makasuap anga sun?
ui, makasuap anga ken.
aku inika sun a semuap?
namakasuap anga aken.
saw! djuasi azua namakungay a zaleman.
ui, malap aken tua zuking.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: saw djuasi a azua namaqungevuljan a qezung.
S.TRANSL: 窗戶都是灰塵，去擦一下。
The windows are full of dust, go wipe them.

S.FORM: inika aken a makadjuas, kedri aravac aken.
S.TRANSL: Wait a minute, I'm still sweeping the floor.

S.FORM: uri kemuda sun nusauni?
uri kemin aken tjai sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: uri sema tjumaq sun nusauni?
S.TRANSL: Do you want to go home later?

S.FORM: uri vaik amen a semenay kata ku qali.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: uri kemuda timadju nu qemacuvung ta vaveciken?
S.TRANSL: What does he do after he finishes his homework?

S.FORM: uri vaik a kemavekav timadju.
izua ti muakay i tjumaq?
idu saqumaqanu izua timadju i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: izua ti ljeljeng i tjumaq?
neka! anema su sikikim tjaimadju?
S.TRANSL: 沒有，她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tima sun?
vuvu, ti tjuku aken, suqeljevi.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Panay, please open the door.

S.FORM: tima sun?
kuliw, ti pia aken, ari kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: kuliu, I’m piya, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: sicuayan anga tja inucevungan.
ui! singlit anga tjen tjanusun, idu pangetjezu a kivala.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們很想念你。來家裡坐坐吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: qiladju, tekelu ta zaljum.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: masalu.
tekelu ta utja.
semuqusaw angata a nu utja.
idu! kanu ta veljevelj, a ku kinacu a kemsi qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 來!我們來吃香蕉，我從部落帶來的。

S.FORM: sasanguaqan angata ca veljevelj nutjapacunan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: paka sanguaq sun?
ui, sanguaq angata.
idu kani, namakakesa anga ti kina tua tja kaiven.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: ui, vaik aken a pilima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: pai! suliavu a keman, inika tjen a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，我們又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: mavetu anga aken masalu.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: suliavu, maya masiaq.
ui sanguaq a nu kinesa.
uri vaik anga aken, mangetjez anga aken nu tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: ui, kigalju anga i djalan.
uri vaik anga aken a ma tjumaq, ljazuanga vengin.
kivalau anga nu tjaivililj.
kigalju anga i djalan.
ui, nu izua su tenget kivalau anga.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: djavadjavai a mapuljat, nusauni uri vaik itjen a sema qinaljan a paljilji tjaivuvu i cudjuy.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，今天我們要去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: bulay angata!
uri djemaljun anga itjen?
ui, uri djemaljun anga.
vuvu, paljiljiljilji amen tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: ia! bulay angata, aku mun a macaqu a penaiwanan!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說排灣語， 啊!真是太棒了!
You guys speak Paiwanese! That’s great!

S.FORM: djavadjavai a mapuljat, nusauni uri vaik itjen a sema puvaquan a masengeseng.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，今天去我們要去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: ui, sinsi
idu, uri vaik anga itjen, kaciuciuri a mapuljat, paqenetju a nu turivecan.
S.TRANSL: 來!大家過來，我們要出發囉，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ui sinsi, na masi turivecan anga amen.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: djemaljun anga itjen?
ini anan ljacadja puvaquan.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: saw! pazaljumi a puvaquan.
ui, tiaken na pazaljum.
saw! alapu ta qapeqap.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: ui, tiaken a venilad ta qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: djavadjavay a mapuljat, uri vaik itjen a pacun ta qemuziquzip nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: cuay anga aken a kikaljavaljava, saka anema tja pakazuavan?
S.TRANSL: 我期待很久了!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: maka basu itjen.
ljevavavu anan, veneli aken ta kipu.
S.TRANSL: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ui
tjaljiqaca aravac ca imaza, mareka qayaqayam a i maza, qatjuvi a izua. liaw anan a mare timaljimalji a qemuziquzip kigaljuvu a pacun.
S.TRANSL: 動物園很大，這裡是鳥類，那邊是蛇類，還有很多不同的動物，你們慢慢看。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.There are many different animals, take your time.

S.FORM: sinsi marekutj aken ta qatjuvi.
pumayan, saw pacunu ta qayaqayam numaya.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: kaqepui anga imaza nu pasuvililj ta cengelj a tjelu a milingan.
S.TRANSL: 下午3點，我們在這裡集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ui masalu sinsi.
anema nu pinacunan kasauni?
liaw a nia pinacunan a maretimaljimalji a qatjuvi kata qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: 我們看到了好多蛇和鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: ari anga, uri vaik anga itjen.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: kaljavau aken, masetu anga ku kula.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: kiciur sun a kemavekav?
ui, kiciur aken tjanumun.
tjuruvu angata kemavekavekav imaza.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: kaimazavi a kemavekav, ljataladj a aravac zaljum izua.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: anema su pinakazuanan a mamaza?
gemaljugalju aken a djemavac a sema maza.
anema su ljinevavavan?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: na ljevavaw aken ta basu.
uri kemuda sun a sema kuikay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: uri cumuin aken ni kama a sema kiukay.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸要開車載我去教會。

S.FORM: djemavadjavac timadju a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: ini, maka ta tjiing timadju a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: kemuda a su vuvu a veneli ta ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: ramaljeng anga ti vuvu, ljakua maqati anan a emutubay a veneli ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 雖然vuvu年紀大了,但是還能騎摩托車去買菜。
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: maka hikuki sun a sema drani?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: ini, uri maka ta varukur aken a sema drani.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: saka, uri kemuda timadju a sema drani?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uri maka ta hikuki timadju uta.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: anema ljinevavauvan nimadju a sema takaw?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: malingac a ljevavaw ta basu timadju, qaw! na maka ta kauty timadju a sema takaw.
S.TRANSL: 他搭巴士會暈，所以他搭高鐵去高雄。
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: na maka ta kisia timadju a sema valangaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ui na maka kisiya timadju a sema valangaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: na maka kisia timadju a sema valangaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ini, na maka ta hikuki timadju a sema valangaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: inu a tjalja demutan ta siljevavavan ta basu?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: sevecu a pasa sangas, mapacun a siljevavavan ta basu.
S.TRANSL: 順著往前走就會看到公車站了。
If you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: izua ljaljevavavan ta tjiin imaza?
S.TRANSL: Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: neka nu tjiin imaza, amin a haia a su ljevavavan.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: nu maka ta basu, pida milingan a tja sidjaljun i gakku?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: tapuluq saka lima a bung, djemaljun itjen.
uri pida milingan, nu ljevavaw itjen ta kauti a kemasi takaw a tjalju taiciw?
S.TRANSL: 從高雄搭高鐵到台中要多久時間?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: ita a milingan a tja sidjaljun.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: cuay nu emungeting itjen a sema udray?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: kimaya ita a milingan.
uri maka ta tiin sun a ma tjanuamen?
S.TRANSL: 你今天要搭捷運來我家嗎?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: izua ku kudain, ika aken a maqati a sema tjanumun nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 我有事，今天沒辦法過去。

S.FORM: saigu sun a zemingdingsia?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: ui, saigu aken a zimdingsia.
izua su utubay?
ui, izua ku utubai a ita.
izua su utubay?
neka ku utubay.
djavadjavay vuvu, ti kadruy aken, tuki maqati aken a kivadaq itjanusun?
ui, ika makuda.
ljakua, ika makudakuda a ku kineljang.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: izua su tenget nu pasuvililj ta cengelj?
S.TRANSL: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: ui i tjumaq aken.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: nasakivadaq aken tjanusun a pakatua milimilingan nua paiwan. tuki izua su tenget nu kadjaman?
S.TRANSL: 你明天早上有空嗎?我想問您關於排灣族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Paiwan people.

S.FORM: neka aken i tjumaq yu. uri vaik amen a kivaqu nutiaw.
S.TRANSL: 明天我們要去山上採小米，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: naselangeda aken tu liaw a su kineljakeljang a pakatua kakudanan nua paiwan. tuki maqati aken a kivadaq tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對排灣族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Paiwan people, so I would like to ask you something.

S.FORM: ui, ljakua pangetjezu anga nu sikatjelu a kadjamadjaman.
S.TRANSL: 好的，但是，請你後天早上再來。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: tuki maqati aken a semasing tjanusun a seman iga?
S.TRANSL: 不知是否我能錄影製作成影片?
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: ui, maqati inikamakuda.
vuvu, pida anga su cavilj tucu?
siva a puluq saka alu anga ku cavilj.
vuvu, aku tarivak anan a su kinacavacavan, ika makeljang a su cavilj.
S.TRANSL: vuvu,您很健康喔,看不出您的年紀。

S.FORM: ini lja! ramaleng anga ken, neka anga ku djuludjuluin.
S.TRANSL: 沒有啦!我已經老了，很多事沒辦法做了。

S.FORM: na kemasinu sun vuvu?
kemasi kuvaleng aken.
paiwan a su cekelj uta?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是排灣族人嗎?
Is your wife also a Paiwan?

S.FORM: ini, sepiuma timadju.
izua anan a su kinacaqu a zuma a kai?
ui, macaqu aken ta na Amis kata na sepiuma
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: vuvu, naqemaljup sun kasicuayan?
S.TRANSL: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ui, ru qaljup aken kasicuayan, qenetji liaw anga ku qinaljup a sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 是的。我以前經常上山打獵,請看這裡有很多的獵物。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: masalu aravac tua su tjaucikel kasauni, liaw anga ku sinivecik.
S.TRANSL: vuvu,非常感謝您今天的分享，我做了很多記錄。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: aicu a ku sinitjaucikel kasauni, ku linangedan a kemasi ta ramaljemaljeng a tja kakudan kasicuayan.
S.TRANSL: 我剛才所説的，是祖先所流傳的文化。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: vuvu aianga su luljayan, tjaljumaza a ku sikivadaq tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: vuvu今天辛苦您了，今天的訪談先到這裡。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: inikamakuda, ljakua namaqusaw sun?
ini, uri vaik anga aken, maqati aken a lemangeda ta su tjaucikel a milimilingan nu tjaivililj?
S.TRANSL: 不了,我要離開了，我下次可以聽到更多的故事嗎?
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: ui! pangetjezu anga nu tjaivililj, kigalju anga i djalan.
anema su velin? tjuku.
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uri veneli aken ta kupu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: izua anan a su velin?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: veneli anan aken ta tjalupung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: paveliveli mun ta kupu?
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: izua pida su velin?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: paveliveli mun ta saviki?
neka, tima uri mapu.
S.TRANSL: No, we don’t sell betel nut.

S.FORM: veneli aken ta djuadjuay a paday.
pida su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pavai aken tu tjelu ta djuadjuay a paday.
vuvu na saveneli aken ta cinapa a vurasi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: gemalju anga sun, neka anga vurasi.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: uri veneli aken tu drusa ta abudra.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: ita anga.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: velian aken ta qecilu.
makudakuda su velin a qecilu?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: velian aken ta qecilu tu drusa iday.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: veneli aken tu drusa ta talekelekan a ada.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: veliu ca tjelu a talekelekan a ada lja!
S.TRANSL: 這裡剩下的三把蔥都賣你啦!
There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: pida cu a paday?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: tjelu a iday nu talubukan.
tjelu a iday tu drusa puluq saka ita a penuljat, kana su pavain aken tu tjelu a iday tu drusa a puluq.
ui masalu.
siva a puluq saka lima a valjitjuq imaza.
veneli anan aken, ku pazuljuan tu masan taiday.
S.TRANSL: I’ll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: lima a iday saka tapuluq a su vinelian a penuljat.
maqati a su kisangen a pacengeceng tu masan lima a iday?
inika maqati.
manu pazangal lja nu paveli sun ta nemanga, maqati a su papedjuluin?
S.TRANSL: 這個你也賣太貴了吧!可以算便宜一點嗎?
It’s too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: inika maqati, madjulu anga.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: saka numatazua, veneli aken tu kedri ta alju.
S.TRANSL: 不然，我只要買一點點糖果。
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: amin cu a su velin?
maqati a ku kisedjaman sun ta paisu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: pida su kisedjamen?
na madraudrau aken a masi paisu ka kadjaman, maqati sun a pasedjam tjanuaken?
S.TRANSL: 我早上忘了帶錢，你可以借我錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: neka nu naseliaw a ku sipasedjam tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有多餘的錢可以借你耶!
I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: mayanga, inika su pinacikel a su kinisedjam ka tjaisangas.
S.TRANSL: 而且，你還沒還我上次借的錢餒。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: maqati aken a kisedjam ta su kava?
maqati, saw alapu ta su sikava.
S.TRANSL: 好，你自己拿你要穿的衣服。

S.FORM: maqati a su pasedjaman aken ta su sunatj?
ku sinipasedjam anga tjai kapi.
nasakisedjam aken ta su zidingsia, maqati?
S.TRANSL: 我想跟你的腳踏車，可以借我嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: maqati, ljakua pacikelu anga nutiaw.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: qemudjalj anga, namasi ljinay sun?
S.TRANSL: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: izua ku ljinay, kaciuri a ljeminay numaya!
S.TRANSL: 我有帶傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: pacikel aken tjanusun ta ku kinisedjam ka tjaisangas a sunatj.
S.TRANSL: 我要還你上次借我的書。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: nasapacun anan sun ta zuma a sunatj?
S.TRANSL: You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: nungida anga a ku sivalit tjanusun ta paisu?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: pumayan, pacikelu anga nu izua su paisu.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nungida su valitan aken ta su kinisedjam a paisu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: ku valitan sun nutiaw.
S.TRANSL: I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nungida su pacikelen a ku sunatj.
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: aku ku pinacikel anga katiaw?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: ti pia napasedjam tjanusun ta inpic?
S.TRANSL: Did Pia lend you this pen?

S.FORM: ui, pinasedjaman aken ta inpic nimadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: aicu a inpic su kinisedjam tjai piya?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from piya?

S.FORM: ini, vinelian na ku kina tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是媽媽買給我的。
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: neka anga qatia, kisedjamu ta nia tjuku.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, so let's borrow some from tjuku.

S.FORM: ui, ku kisedjamay.
pacikelu ayavu ti muni ta kinisedjam tjanuaken a paisu.
S.TRANSL: Go tell mumi to return my money.

S.FORM: pida kinisedjam a paisu tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: uri sema inu sun?
uri vaik aken a temalem ta ljaceng a sema ta ku puljacengan.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: anema su kudakudain?
uri ku ljivaseng ca namasan cemecemel anga a kadjunangan.
S.TRANSL: There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: alapan aken ta dramia kata pitaw.
S.TRANSL: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: ku pinizua i ljaving ta kakara.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: na kemangekang anga sun?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: na kemakang anga ken, uri ku vusaman nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 我剛犁過田，待會兒要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: maqati anga tjen a kiljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: amin a qaudriudri a maqati a nu kiljacengen.
S.TRANSL: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: liaw angata a su kinivurasi
S.TRANSL: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: seqetju a pasa kuvkuv aicu a ku kinivurasi.
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: anema nu kudakudain?
qemayuqayu amen i veljeluan, uri kiciqaw amen.
S.TRANSL: 我們正在搗魚藤,準備抓魚.
I’m pounding the vines for fish.

S.FORM: liaw a ciqaw imaza?
namapeljuq anga dradrakuyan ta nia kiniciqaw.
S.TRANSL: The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: seman dringay aken ta ku siqaljup
S.TRANSL: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: aicu nua vavuy a djekap.
S.TRANSL: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: aku su sikeljang?
makeljang tu djinavacan nua vavuy a qelju.
S.TRANSL: 看得出來是山豬走過的痕跡。
I can see the traces of the boar.

S.FORM: ari tjapacunay a tjadringay.
S.TRANSL: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: nasemequ anga vatu.
S.TRANSL: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

S.FORM: anema su alalangen?
S.TRANSL: 你在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: aicu a rusung sipudringay ta kulavaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是籠子陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a cage trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: anema nemanga a su pinizua
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: aicu sidringadringay ta takec ni kama.
S.TRANSL: 這是爸爸專門抓山羌的陷阱。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: masalu angata ta naqemati, liaw a tja qinaljupan kasauni.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天很多獵物。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: ui angatalja! masalu aravac tua sinipagaugaw tjanuitjen nua naqemati.
S.TRANSL: 是的!非常感謝上主的恩賜!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: nusauny uli temulu aken tjanumun aza dubuc kemuda lukai ta pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家動物的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: nusauny uli temulu aken tjanumun aza cemel kemuda lukai ta pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家植物的排灣語怎麼說。

S.FORM: nusauny uli temulu aken tjanumun aza kudamunu kemuda lukai ta pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家水果的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: maya taqed.
maya kiljavaran.
maya keman ta nemanga.
patjevutaw su sapitj.
patjevutaw su inpic..
patjevutaw su vavecikan..
sananguaqu a sapitj.
sananguaqu a inpic.
sananguaqu a kakanen.
sananguaqu a vangavanga.
nia ken.
nima ca sapitj.
ni giyu.
nima ca siquliqulip?
ika en kemeljan.
azua ni camak a hansudi?
ini! ni akay a tjiaku.
sinsi, ika na masi sapitj aken.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: kiciul kata ljaqediqedi maciul a pacun.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: mapengedruq a ku inpic.
ayau ta yincepi a venecik..
maulaw a u siquliqulip.
u sipasedjam a siquliqulip tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: uli tjaljumaza tja kitulu, nu sema tjumaq kigalju anga i djalan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心。
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: ui. masalu sinsi.
uli tjaljumaza tja kitulu, mecevungi anga mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: vaikanga sinsi.
djavadjavay, a mapuljat. a ku ngadan ti buya.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is buya.

S.FORM: buya djavadjavay.
djavadjavay a mapuljat, a ku ngadan ti kuliw.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is kuliw.

S.FORM: kuliw djavadjavay.
djavadjavay, ti buya ken.
buya djavadjavay, tiaken ti sakinu.
djavadjavay, tiaken ti kuliw.
kuliw djavadjavay, tiaken ti sakinu.
tima sun?
tiaken ni kiusi a kina, ti tjuku a ken.
tima sun?
ni kiusi a tjakeri a kaka vavayan, a ku ngadan ti kenge.
S.TRANSL: 我是kiusi的妹妹，我的名字是kenge。
I am kiusi’s sister. My name is kenge.

S.FORM: tima zua?
timadju niaken a sinsi, ti sedjam a ngadan.
tima a caucau?
timadju ku kaka tjavulung uqaljay, ti utjung a ngadan.
timadju ti buya?
ui, timadju ti buya.
ti buya sun?
ini, ti sakinu a ken.
tima ti buya?
avan ti buya ken.
tima ti sakinu?
ti sakinu niaken a qali.
tima ngadan na su kaka tjavulung a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: a ngadan na ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan ti ljeljeng.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is ljeljeng.

S.FORM: tima ngadan na su kaka tjakeri a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: a ngadan na ku kaka tjakeri a vavayan ti gesi.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is gesi.

S.FORM: kemeljan sun ta ngadan nimadju?
a ngadan nimadju ti buya.
pidanga cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: tucu puluq sa lima anga cavilj nimadju.
pida anga cavilj na su kaka tjakeri a uqaljay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: tucu lima anga cavilj nimadju.
a nu qinaljan izua gaku?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: izua.
kitulutulu sun itua qinaljan a gaku?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ui, nu kitulu amen i gaku matu taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: tima zua uqaljay?
ku djisan timadju.
tima zua vavayan.
u kaka tjavulung a vavayan.
tima zua qaqunuan?
u kaka tjakeri a uqaljay.
anema sengsengan na su kina?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: sividay timadju.
anema sengsengan na su kama?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: sinsi timadju.
timadju su kaka tjakeri a uqaljay?
ini, timadju na ku kaka tjakeri uqaljay a qali.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: timadju su kaka tjavulung a vavayan?
ini, u kaka tjakeri a vavayan timadju.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: mapida mun a taqumaqanan?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: izua lima taqumaqanan niamadju.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: mapida nu taqumaqanan a kakerian?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: ma sepatj a nia aljak.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: mapida su kaka tjakeri uqaljay kata vavayan?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka ku kaka tjakeri a uqaljay, izua tjelu tjakeri a kaka vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: mapida su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay kata vavayan.
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay kata vavayan.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: mapida su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka ku siruvetjek.
marekaka mun a uqaljay?
ui, timadju ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay.
kacalisian mun?
ui, kacalisian na men.
paiwazuku timadju tauta?
ui, timadju paiwanzuku uta.
kasauny makuda kalevelevan?
a kalevelevan pasu ljaljeqel, temekel itjen tua linalja a zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: kasauny makuda kalevelevan?
a kalevelevan pasu semezam, temekel itjen tua liaw a zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點熱，我們要多喝水。
It’s a bit hot, so we need to drink more water.

S.FORM: makuda kalevelevan i sasaw?
qaca qadaw, paqenetju kiljaungu tua qadaw.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: makuda kalevelevan i sasaw?
liaw qerepus, neka qadaw i kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: makuda kalevelevan nutiyaw?
nutiyaw neka qadaw, liaw qerepus, qaca vali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: tazua qadaw makuda kalevelevan?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: tazua qadaw pasu ljaljeqel, kavau ta tjiaku nu ljisasaw.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: nu kilavay makuda kalevelevan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: nu kilavay sarenguaq a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: tazua qadaw uri qemudjalj?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: tazua maqadaw a kalevelevan, ika qemudjalj.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: tazua qadaw uri qemudjalj?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ui, uri qemudjalj nu tazua qadaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: tucu na qemudjalj ri?
meljay anga, tjevutanga qadaw.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: izua qudjalj tucu?
qemudjalj anga, ika namasi ljinay aken.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj a i sasaw?
tucu ika qemudjaqudjalj, ljakua pasuvililj ta cengelj uri qemudjalj, kacu tua ljinay.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: nacavilj uri ljaljeqel a kaljavuceleljan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ui, nu icavilj uri ljaljeqel a kaljavuceleljan, kavau tu liaw ta kava.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: tucu a cavilj kisemezam a kaljazalazangan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ui, nu kaljazalazangan uri semezam, temekel tjen tu liaw ta zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: tjengelay sun tua kaljavevuan.?
tjenglay ken ta kaljavevuan, semeljec a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: tjengelay su ta kaljaulagan?
ika ken na tjengelay ta kaljaulagan, izua liaw a buhu nu kaljaulagan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: madraudraw a ken kemacu ta sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: tiaken kati sun kaciuli a pacun.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: madraudraw aken kemacu ta siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: u pasedjamy sun.
na madraudraw sun a kemacu ta inpic?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ui pasedjamy aken ta su inpic?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: nu cengelj anema su kanen?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: uli keman na ken ta pang.
anema su kanen a kaiven?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: uli keman na ken ta paday.
anema su kinan a kenamain?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: na keman aken ta qucilu.
anema su kinan a cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: na keman aken ta vuyu.
ali vaiki djemakedjak ta bulu.
sausaunan, nusauny u su kimaw anga.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: ali vaik a kemavekav.
ui! ali kaciuli.
ali kivanvan ta bulu.
ilang, alianan semakuc ta sunatj.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: na kimuremur anga sun?
inianan, semenasenaw a ken ta kisi tucu.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: na menuremur anga sun?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: na menuremur anga ken.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: su sinenaw anga kisi?
maka senaw anga ken ta kisi.
akumaya ika na pilima sun?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: nusauny u senavay anga.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: kasauny anema su kudakudaing.
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: uli vaik a en kemin ta sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: nu puaming kitulu anema kudaing nimadju?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: uli vaik a uduli timadju.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: akay, i tjumaq sun?
izua, kilimu a ljitaladju.
akay, i tjumaq sun?
neka ti akay i tjumaq ! ti ljeljeng aken, anema su sikimkim? nu mangetjez ku tjumaljay anga ti akay.
S.TRANSL: akay不在家耶!我是ljeljeng，有什麼事嗎?回來我會轉告akay。
akay is not at home. I am ljeljeng. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: tima mun?
vuvu, ti savan akay a men, pusaladj amen a semuqeljev.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是savan 和 akay，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are savan and akay, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: tima?
ti buya ken, kemikim aken tjai kapi
S.TRANSL: I am buya, I am here for kapi.

S.FORM: vuvu, mangtjez a ken paljilji tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: sicuayan nangata su pinantjezan, singelit aken aravac tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: savan, mangetjez aken kemin tjanusun a kivanvan.
S.TRANSL: savan, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: kilimu ljitaladju, cuayanga ken a kemaljavaljava tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: aicu u talem a vurasi, paqayami a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看。
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: aicu vurasi qaljemeqem angata.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: idu! aicu u talem a kudamunu, paqayami a keman.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: aicu a kudamunu qaljemeqem angata.
qiladju! aicu inika kinusulian a puday tiaken a na temalem kanu pay !
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: u! ca puday qaljemeqem angata.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: sakeman sun ta tjanes?
ika keman na en ta tjanes, keman na en ta ringku.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: uli keman sun ta pingkan?
ui, tjengelay en.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: u sitjuljakan sun ta kudamunu sipakan tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: masalu, aicu a kudamunu liaw qetim.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: malap aken ta zaljum sipatekel tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: masalu.
su liaw keman, liaw ku sinandjamay.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: u! salulum angata saka sanguaq tauta.
S.TRANSL: 嗚!真的很香而且也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: su liaw keman, izuanan liaw imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: ika masiaq anga ken yu!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: su liaw keman, izuanan liaw imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: liaw anga u kinan, dikinay anga keman.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: nusauny uli ku kacuing mun a sema vavuwa.
S.TRANSL: 我今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: aya ti kina liaw cacalag i vavuwa.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: nusauny uli ku kacuing mun a sema can.
S.TRANSL: 我今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: uli vaik itjen a kemangkang.
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: nusauny uli vaik itjen a mainu?
uli kacuing tjen sema pana ni sinsi.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: nusauny uli vaik itjen mainu?
uli kacuing tjen ni sinsi a sema vavuwa.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: nusauny uli vaik tjen a sema pana?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ini, uli kacuing tjen a sema vavuwa ni sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: nusauny uli vaik itjen a sema vavuwa?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ini, nusauny uli vaik itjen sema can.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, ama uli tja pacunan i pana?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: vaik itjen a pacun ta tungbu.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, uli vaik itjen ma vavuwa pacun ta anema?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: ali vaiki pacun ta kadradrungulj.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: anema tja kudaing a ma can?
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: uli vaik amen ma can paljilji tua nia talem a puday, kinemenemu izua sasiq, pangac yu!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinsi uli vaik itjen a sema pana kemavekav?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ini, uli vaik itjen pacun ta tungbu.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi uli vaik itjen sema can temalem ta ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: uli vaik itjen a kemangkang.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: izua za tungbu a minlayalayap.
kasauny sipuita pacun ta valjualjut a tungbu.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: izua za kadradrungulj a minlayalayap.
yi! wa! tjengelay a ken ta kadradrungulj, sasanguwaq.
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: izua za kadradrungulj a minlayalayap.
ika kadradrungulj azua, pangac azua.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: pacucunu imaza, maya vaik a ljacadja ta kadjunangan yu!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ui, ika men na vaik a pasa ljacadja ta kadjunangan.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: maya mekelj, kigalju a djemavac tjakuyanga sekulilj.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: sa djaljaw ken a pacun.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: kemuda sun a sema tapaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: uli ungeting aken ta zidusiya sema tapaw.
uli kemuda vaik a biuing timadju?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: na djemavac timadju sema biuing.
uli kemuda sun vaik a sema penhu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw aken ta hikuki sema penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: uli kemuda sun vaik a sema penghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw aken ta varukur sema penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: anema su ljivavaven a sema tjumaq.
ljivavaw ta tjiing a sema tjumaq.
anema ljivavaven ni tjuku a sema gaku?
S.TRANSL: How does tjuku go to school?

S.FORM: ljivavaw ta kisia sema gaku ti tjuku.
S.TRANSL: tjuku goes to school by train.

S.FORM: anema ljivavaven ni camak a sema kiukay?
S.TRANSL: How does camak go to church?

S.FORM: padjidingsia ti camak sema kiukay.
S.TRANSL: camak goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: ljivavaw sun ta tjiing sema gaku?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ui, padjidingsia ken a sema gaku.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw sun ta kauty sema takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ui, ljivavaw aken ta kauty sema takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw sun ta kisia tuki hikuki? a sema taitu?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: ljivavaw aken ta hikuki, ljivavaw ta hikuki tja djaljaw tua kisia.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw ta basu tuki emungeting a sema kiukay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: emungeting aken sema kuikay, nu paka ta basu tja salenguaq a emungeting.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: demut a iciba ta nu umaq?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ljacadja, nu vaik sema iciba pautubay aken.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: aza iubingkiyuku a kinacadjan kata gaku demut ri ?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: ljadut, djemavac itjen.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: aza kakanan a kinacadjan kata tisiaba demut ri ?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: tjevuta ta tisiaba djemavac tu lima bung djemaljun.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: izua su djikan nusauny?
makuda?
savaik a en paljilji tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: nusauny izua u kudaing neka i tjumaq, nu tjaivililj anga a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: saka nutiaw izua su djikan? nu pasuvililj tua cengelj u kimaw sun.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: dikilu, u kaljavaljavaw sun i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: dikilu aken semeljup tua su zaing? sa kiruku aken.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: ui! dikilu inikamakuda!
dikilu a remuing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: sekulung aken, ika pinarimasudj a kuvaw, maya lja!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦！
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: nu maitazua semasing aken numaya.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: ika kisasing tauta.
masalu tjanusun gemaugaw tua ku sikivadaq.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: inikamakuda, anema su sa kivadaqan?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: kivadaqaw sun ka maqacuvucuvung anan sun anema su sengsengan?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kasicuayan kinsac a ken, ljakua tucu na kitjaulanga en.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: sa tucu izua su sengsengan ?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: i gaku a ku kakasengsengan.
kivadaqaw a kinaizuanan na su aljak i qinaljan tauta?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ini, a kinaizuanan na u aljak i hici.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: sa macidicidilj sun i tua su kinaizuanan?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: izuanan ku qinuzip ita vatu kata qayaqayam, tiamadju matu ku taqumaqanan tauta.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: na qemuzip a en tu ita ta ngiyaw uta, izua dubuc na zemang ika masepelj.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: sa kivadaq aken tjanusun tua pakata qemaljup a palisi.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ika liaw u kineljang, ljakua a ku kineljan tjara ku tevelay sun
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: aza nimun siqaljuqaljup a kuwang a turivecan izua anema palisi?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: aza tja siqaljup kuwang a turivecan dikinay vavayan a cemelcel.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: aza vavayan dikilu kiciul a qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: dikinay, a vavayan inika dikilu a qemaljup tauta.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: buya nekanga vauwa i tjumaq, sau veliu ta vauwa.
S.TRANSL: buya，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
buya, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: izuanan ita dalilj i kakesan. pasaladji a venely.
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: talanay a ita dalilj, sau veliu anan tu drusa mangetjez.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: uli veneli aken ta vauwa, pavelively mun?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: izua ! uli pida su velin?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: uli venely aken tu drusa dalilj, venely anan tua talubukan a paday
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: imaza paday, anemanan su kinasaljingan?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: uli venely anan ken ta qecilu, izua nimun?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: nekanga nia qecilu na sepavei anga.
uli venely aken ta kava.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: anema su kinasaljinga a alang.
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: uli venely aken tua hansudi a kava.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: aicu qudjidjilj a kava makuda?
izua malji a quljaw.
izuanan niamen a vuteqiteqilj kata cangiangia.
S.TRANSL: : We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: pavai a ken ta cangiangia a kava tu ita.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: camak na mainu sun kasauny? na vaik sun a undu?
S.TRANSL: camak你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, uli vaik pusaladj ta ku vuvu vavayan pavely ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: maitazua! izua su djikan nu qezemetj? timitja kaciul a kaiv.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: dikinay, uli vaik aken venely tua kava.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: saka kiciul aken tjanusun a vaik.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: djavadjavay, kivadaqaw aicu a talekelekan a ljaceng pida pakiyaw?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: a ljaceng nu ita talekelekan drusa puluq a pakiyaw.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: aicu a vurasi pida paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: a vurasi nu ita tjingtjing tjelu puluq a pakiyaw.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: pavai en tu drusa talekelekan a ljaceng kata ita tjingtjing a vurasy.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: camak madraudraw a kemacu ta tingnaw ken, dikilu sun a pasedjam tjanuaken?
S.TRANSL: camak，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
camak, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: neka niaken tauta, aicu ni muni.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is muni’s.

S.FORM: dikilu pasedjam tjanuaken a palamu? djaljaw ki u pacikely tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ui, alapu.
masalu, pusaladji anga ken a pasemalaw tjai muni tu masalu.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank muni for me.

S.FORM: anemanan su kinasaljinga?
uli pacikel aken tua aicu a drusa sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ui, uli saljinganan sun ta anema?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: tiaken uli kisedjam anan ta aicu tjelu a sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ui, nusikatjelu anga paqenetju a pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: inianan pacikel sun ta ku siquluqulip.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: katiaw u pinacikel anga.
aza ku siquliqulip manu mainu maulav anga.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: su sinipasedjam tjai camak anga.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to camak?

S.FORM: ika ken kemeljang. u vaiki a kivadaq timadju.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: pasedjamay anan sun ta u siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: muni, ti camak a na pasedjam tjanusun tucu a tjiaku?
S.TRANSL: muni, did camak lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini, aicu na u kina vinelian tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mamaw tjiaku kati camak.
S.TRANSL: camak’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: a nimadju tjiaku qecengecengel, ika mamaw niamen quljaw.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: muni, na kisedjam sun ta paisu ni camak?
S.TRANSL: muni, did you borrow money from camak?

S.FORM: izua, uli pacikeleng angata kasauny tjaimadju, ljakua madraudraw a kemacu ta paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: sa nungida uli su pacikeleng?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: nutiaw u pacikelaw anga tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ui, u pusaladjay sun a pasemalav tjai camak.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell camak for you.

S.FORM: nu djemekep tua kulavaw ayaing ta siqezetjan tua qaciljay a dringay, a djemekep tua tjikuray ayaing ta veceqel a dringay.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: manu maitucu, pasalisaliw anga ken djaljepan ika na djemameq.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: u su tuluvi anga tu kemuda cukulu ta drusa malji a dringay.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ui! bulay ngata! nu maitucu uli macaqu a djemekep ta sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: laladruqan anga cemel i can, sau alapu ta dramiya i kuvaw, ali semavavua.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: pini inu a dramiya?
aza itua cepeng a gidigidi, nu ljitaladj sun ta kuvaw su pacuanan anga.
S.TRANSL: 在簍子的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: kigalju a malap, maya mapasaqetju. ladjay a dramiya.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: maya djemulat a ku dringay!
inuan a su dringay?
a ku dringay izua i petekuteku ta kasiw.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: akumaya paqenetj sun?
imaza u pinizua ta pukeljang, kemeljang a ken ta u dringay tu inu.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: aicu a kadrau tja pasa maza i pana a kiciqaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: aza izua neka tja kadrau, tiamen ayaing ta panadip a djemekep ta ciqaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: inianan paqayam a panadip a ken, nu tjaivililj tului anga ken wi?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ui! nu tjaivililj maciuli anga panadip.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: nu tjaivililj u tului anga sun ta seman kadrau
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: midradrua su panadip, qadjaw izua ciqaw na makalavic! kilimu lakacu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: galjuanan, mirarua ravac a varukur, imaza en a lemakac ta panadip, sau mazua pusaladj a malap tua ku aralj.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了，我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: lakacu a ciqaw pasa maza tjanuaken, u pusaladjay sun a lemakac.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: bulay angata! kasauny pulamy, aza kadrangu na mapeljuq anga.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: kilimu vaiki tja sipaseljavak katua mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: mangedjez anga ti sinsi.
maya kivangavang anga, qiladju kilimu i ta qiladjan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: pazekadjan, gemaljuanga ken.
tedepu a kilimu.
sikapida qadaw tucu?
sikalima a’adaw tucu, pulavay nu tiyav, kaciwciwli anga vayika kivangavang!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: nanguwa! vayikanga djen a semapana.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: sikapida ’adaw nu tiyiav?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: sikadjelu nu tiyav, nu tiyave a makakecengelj vayikanga djen a kivangavang ta benulu!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: anema su kudayin nu tiyav a qadjaman?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: sikapidjulj nu tiyav, vayiq a ken sema kiyukay kati kina.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
pasumudjaq ken, vayiq a ken sema bingzu(aluvu).
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: malingace alavac a ku qulu.
su sikebung anan a kisuzeliyan.
sinsi, sakedju a ku djiyalj, pasa mabingzu.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ui, sau pakilimu.
makaiy(dikilu) ken a vayika pilima?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: uri paluwanga ta kakituluan, galjuwanan a su sivayiq.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, sa’edju a ku ’ulu, kivada ken nu maka kingcengelj.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ui, kinemenemu a madjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, uri kivadaq a ken nu djayvililj a sika ita qadaw, vayiq aken kipacun ta kuysang.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ui, kiljivakan a su kinacavacavan.
maynu ti paday?
sa’edju a djialj ni madju, i bingzu ti madju.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: inuan ti kadraw?
sinsi, sa’edju a djugerau ni kadraw, na kivada tusaa ’adaw.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, kadraw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: awmaya ini a mangedjez ti paday?
na masezam ti madju.
pai kipakeljangu dja nu sun.
a ku ngada ti camak, tapuluq aku cavilj.
S.TRANSL: My name is camak, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: anemaya su ngadan?
a ku ngada ti camak.
aljaq su na anema zuku?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: aljaq a ken na paywan zuku.
kacalisiyan a su kinacemeqeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ui, paywan amen a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是排灣族人。
Yes, my whole family is paywan.

S.FORM: kacalisiyan a su kinacemeqeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ini, paywan aku kama, paylang aku kina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是排灣族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is paywan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: nima sun a aljak?
aljaq aken ni camak.
su kama a zuwa? pidanga cavilje ni madju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: unem a pulu anga cavilj ni madju.
su kama a zuwa? pidanga cavilje ni madju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ini, niya lamaljeng ti madju i qinalja, alu a pulu anga a cavilj ni madju.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pida anga a cavilj na su kaka djavulung?
a ku kukaka a djavulung ita sa alu pulu a cavilj.
a su kaka djavulung ta cavilj djavulung alavac djanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: lima cavilj a nia tideq.
pida a su pasaqaca?
ita sa sepadj pulu a ku pasaqaca.
cuacuay anga ini a mapacucun, tuki sun na ljavavaw anga?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ui, ita sa djelu a puluq a ku pasavavaw.
tu kisun a meqaca anga?
ini, pasaliv anga a su pinacunan.
maliljai anga sun?
ini, meqaca anga ken.
meqacanga sun?
ui, djelu a pulu anga djindjin a ku siqaacanga tucu.
semay nu sun?
vayike ken sema pangkungse kemim tay singsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: semaynu ti kadraw?
uri vayika venelic ta cemel ti madju.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: inuan ti kadraw?
i ta kakavekavan ti madju, uri malalumalje ta kemavekav ti madju nusawni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: inuan ti paday? uri malalumalje ta mekelje ti madju nusawni.
S.TRANSL: paday在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is paday? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: i ta kakaqepuan ti madj, ku vaykaw a djemaulj ti madj.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: kawdelji a vayiq sema ta aungduan.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: vayikanan akn a kiveli ta cengelj, kalikimen anga sun nusawni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: kaciyuli a vayiq cemaculju ta bingtu!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kalikimu ta zuma, vayiq akn kemim djay sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: kadraw uri malalumalj ta palucivan a sibuluan tu sa ’adaw?
S.TRANSL: Is kadraw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ini, uri malalumalj ta pakuvavaw ti madju.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: uri kisangka sun a malalumaljnu nu ungdukay tazua ’adaw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ui lja, makaya ken a malalumalj ta mekelj.
uri kisangka sun a malalumaljnu nu ungdukay tazua qadaw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: makaya ken a malalumalj ta palucivan a sibuluan.
anema ta kudayin tazuwa qadaw nu ungdukay djen?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri malalumalj djen a malalakac ta calis.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: uri paveli ta kakanen nu ungdukay djen?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ini, uri paveli djen ta djapedjapesen a bulu.
su djameqen a sangasangsan, paqulid tu djaljapalavacan!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: maljimalji.
i djuma ti vuvu a vavayan.
izua, na taqed i umaan ti madju
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: i djuma ti vuvu a vavayan.
neka, djawvayvayiq ti madju, nu masulem i mangdjez.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: i djuma ti vuvu auqaljay
i vavaw a nikay ti madju, saw i vavaw kemin djay madju.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: izua cawcaw i djuma?
ui, kadruy! cuacuay anga ini a pacun dja nusun, na talivaq sun.
S.TRANSL: 是kadruy阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s kadruy. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: nanguwanguwa lja! mangedjez ake a kizepezepan dja nu sun.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: i nuan a su kama?
i ta kakesanan a seman djamadjamay ti madju, vayika ken a djemaulj djay madju.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: maynu anga ti pengay.
vayiq anga sema puvuyuvuyuan djemepeq ta vuyu ti madju
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: vuvu u’aljay mangedjez anga men.
ini a idjumaq a nu vuvu a u’aljay, i suyding ti madju, i djumaq mun a kemaljava ta sipangedjez ni madju.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: mangedjezanga sun ama.
ini a mapacun na cuacuay anga, meqacanga sun.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: na maleva varung pacuna tu mangedjezanga sun.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: aycu a pangudralj sinipavay dja numun, padjingu pasata pingsiyang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: awmay cuwacuayanga ini a mangedjez, ku djawljaw a mapuljat sa maciwli a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: maya ma’udjaw anga, temeqel aken ta uca sakamaya, idu sema keting djen a mazazepzep.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: maljimalji ta su kiniljevakan, uri vaykanga ken.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: aycu a vuyu djaw vucien, ta su kacuin sa galjuannga a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: nanguwa nu tiyiav a makakingcengelj ti sun a ti aken a sicevungan?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ui﹐mecevung djen inuan?
nanguwa mecevun anga djen i tatakesiyan? uri pasasing sa luingen djen.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: nu mayatuzua vaiki a makakaqepuan anga, lemava aken ta ljungpaw a semazua.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: nu mavusilak a veljangaw na djuyis nguwangu alavac i ta nia qinaljan﹐ kalavau a patje mavusilak anga a veljangaw kelju anga kalim djanua ken.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: nu mayatazua mudri maqaljava padje kaljavevuan, sesuay alavace.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: numaya sun nu sipalisiyan ta maljeveq bangdjezan anga.
S.TRANSL: 那你五年祭的時候來吧!

S.FORM: nanguwaq! sakiljaljava ken
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kivada tja nu sun﹐ awmaya nu cemikel sema qinaljan ta sivaljutan
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: vayiq ken a temulu
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: awmaya ini izua i lizuq a temulu
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ayatua singelit aken ta ku qinaljan﹐mayanga saljinga tu pacikelan ta sikamanguan na qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: macaqu sun a cemaqis﹐ti ma na temulu djanusun.
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: mavan a ku vuvu a vavayan, tjalja macaquan a cemaqis i ta nia qinaljan ti madju.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: awmaya izua su vinalungan a kitulu ta cemaqis?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: ni amen a kakudanan a cemeqis, ulja paljazua za kakudanan aku vinalungan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: sanguwa ta tekelen aycu a vinavan ta vaqu.
ti aken a na venava lja!
djlja macakuan sun. cuay a vinavan taycu?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini, pinaka pitjuljan sa pakaluayi. azua si kesan sangasan za djuwadjuway a paday kesayin patjepeliulj, sa vecelelj sana pasazuay ta pikaq sa kadikadi a cengcengan sa seman lipudrupudruin sana ljenguai pasa ta djilung.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。做法把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: anema su sipaveliveli?
izua imaza ku kamangulj kata kecang, savid aku sinitalem lja!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: pida paysu nu drusa penuljat a puvelian.
！nu teveljen pusi a drusa iday sa lima pulu a paysu.
W:djengelay aken tu sa kava﹐pida paysu?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: aucu lima iday a paysu.
pazangal alavac﹐nakuya palja tekuinanan?
S.TRANSL: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: nakuya﹐nu patjateku anan masipun aken.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

S.FORM: ui numaya! za padjalim akn tu ita ’ecengecengel a kava.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: padjalim aken taycua a tjakit kata paliyuq.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: nu teveljen pusi a drusa quzulj﹐aicu ku kinaminan sa sinalima a qiniatian, pusaluan djala makaya cuacuay a sikipusngsenganan.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: nu si siyukay ta ku aliyaliyan mangedjez a qiveli﹐ mkaya papemadjuluin tu qedri
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: ui numaya!pa’eljingay sun tu alu anga sisupuan
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: kelju pacunu! izua itung, djalupung a sipaveliveli.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: kivadaay pida paysu nusa kava?
nu i ta kava djelu itay sa lima puluq a paysu﹐ nu djelu ida qudraw a paysu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: veneli aken tu ita skamaya﹐ lapana ken ta na va’uan.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: djavadjavay﹐pasu veneli akn ta djuadjuay a kinesa sa djinaung a vudjulj.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: maka pavely anga ta kinesa, izuanan a ku tjana a kingekingec, pasa veneli sun?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ui numaya! lapana ken tu ida cavuan﹐ nu djavililj veneli anga ken ta kinesa.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ui. ku sialapan sun sa ljenguwaki pasa ta lupuq﹐ nu maytucu lima puluq a paysu.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.
